meanings.definition: To cause something to begin burning again.
meanings.sent1: Adding more wood to the campfire reignites the flames.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the sun reignites the warmth in the soil.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to blow out the candle before bed reignites the fear of fire hazards.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate speech reignites the spark of rebellion in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The smell of smoke reignites memories of summer bonfires.

meanings.definition: To revive or renew something, such as a feeling or interest.
meanings.sent1: A good book can reignite a love for reading.
meanings.sent2: Traveling to new places reignites a sense of adventure.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist reignites the interest of the audience.
meanings.sent4: His apology reignites the friendship that was fading.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies reignites memories of baking with grandma.
